result.execSummary:
The defendant Radontay Lemar Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
$500.00 BOND APPLIED TO COSTS, BALANCE DUE $43.00.
  Fine and costs to be paid at time of sentencing, unless payment arrangements are approved.  Penalty for non-payment shall be entry of civil judgment.   Clerk of Courts shall docket without fees.  Send payments to:  Clerk of Courts, Room 419, 415 Jackson Street, P O Box 2808, Oshkosh WI  54903-2808.

Consecutive with good time and credit for 6 days time served. Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations. Defendant is currently at the Winnebago County Jail. Court authorizes transfer to Milwaukee County Jail.
  Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
